article:
'Volatile memory', also known as 'volatile storage', is computer memory that
requires power to maintain the stored information, in other words it needs power
to reach the computer memory. Volatile memory retains the information as long as
power supply is on, but when power supply is off or interrupted the stored
memory is lost; unlike non-volatile memory which does not require a maintained
power supply. It has been more popularly known as 'temporary memory'.
